articles.title: Accused data thief threw MacBook into a river to destroy evidence
articles.summary:
Former staffer of Korean e-tailer Coupang accessed 33 million records but may have done less damage than feared

Korean e-tailer Coupang claims a former employee has admitted to improperly accessing data describing 33 million of its customers, but says the accused deleted the stolen data.…
articles.reasoning: The article details a data breach involving improper access and evidence destruction, directly relating to IT policies, security controls, and forensic investigation processes central to IT Governance.

articles.title: China wants to ban making yourself into an AI to keep aged relatives company
articles.summary:
PLUS: Australia buys air-gapped Google Cloud; Huawei triples use of home-built components; JAXA blames low pressure for rocket crash; And more

Asia In Brief  China’s Cyberspace Administration on Saturday posted draft rules governing the behaviour of AI companions that prohibit using them to serve as friends for the elderly.…
articles.reasoning: The article details China's draft regulations for AI companion services, focusing on security, data protection, and compliance requirements, which directly aligns with IT Governance's emphasis on policies, controls, and regulatory adherence for IT systems.

articles.title: When the lights went out, and the shooting started, Y2K started to feel all too real
articles.summary:
More millennial tech support tales from your fellow readers

On Call Y2K  Welcome to a special festive season edition of On Call, in which we share readers' stories of working on the 31st of December 1999 – the moment the tech world held its breath and hoped years of Year 2000 bug remediation efforts would work.…
articles.reasoning: The article discusses IT teams preparing for and responding to the Y2K bug, including decisions about system management and outage reporting, which relates to IT governance frameworks and practices.

articles.title: From AI to analog, cybersecurity tabletop exercises look a little different this year
articles.summary:
Practice makes perfect

It's the most wonderful time of the year … for corporate security bosses to run tabletop exercises, simulating a hypothetical cyberattack or other emergency, running through incident processes, and practicing responses to ensure preparedness if when a digital disaster occurs.…
articles.reasoning: The article discusses organizational resilience and preparedness for cyberattacks, which aligns with strategic management's focus on long-term planning and risk mitigation to protect business objectives.

articles.title: IT team forced to camp in the office for days after Y2K bug found in boss's side project
articles.summary:
The lack of trust that leads to outsourcing can be expensive

On Call Y2K  December 26th is a holiday across much of the Reg-reading world, but it's also a Friday – the day on which we present a fresh instalment of On Call, the reader-contributed column that recounts your tales of tech support encounters and exasperation.…
articles.reasoning: The article implies a failure to realize benefits from IT investments, as the Y2K remediation efforts were compromised by an unmanaged side project, leading to wasted resources (e.g., consultant costs, team overtime) and potential negative outcomes instead of intended value.

articles.title: Salesforce’s ChatGPT integration is really about stopping customers from leaking their own data
articles.summary:
Execs say DIY OpenAI connections risked pushing CRM data past the ‘trust boundary’

Salesforce users running Agentforce with ChatGPT Enterprise or Edu can now update CRM data directly from the bot, a move aimed at curbing home-built integrations that risk spilling data outside the company's controls.…
articles.reasoning: The integration is pitched to reduce workflow inefficiencies and enhance security, which relates to realizing benefits from IT investments, though the article emphasizes risk mitigation over explicit benefit achievement.

articles.title: From video games to cyber defense: If you don't think like a hacker, you won't win
articles.summary:
In supercharged AI race, defenders need to keep up

interview  According to Remedio CEO Tal Kollender, the only way to beat the bad guys hacking into corporate networks is to "think like a hacker," and because not everyone is a teenage hacker turned cybersecurity startup chief executive, she built an AI to do this.…
articles.reasoning: The article mentions funding rounds, client acquisitions, and problem-solving from different angles, which loosely connects to Benefit Realization's focus on achieving intended outcomes and value from initiatives, though the link is indirect.

articles.title: ServiceNow opens $7.7B ticket titled 'Buy security company, make it Armis'
articles.summary:
Customers will be able to see vulnerabilities, prioritize risks, and close them with automated workflows.

After over a week of speculation, ServiceNow announced on Tuesday that it has agreed to buy cybersecurity heavyweight Armis in a $7.75 billion deal that will see the workflow giant incorporate a real-time security intelligence feed into its products.…
articles.reasoning: The article discusses ServiceNow integrating Armis's data discovery tools with its CMDB (Configuration Management Database) to map IT assets and manage vulnerabilities, which involves storing, organizing, and retrieving security-related data for analysis and action.
